title: [Inauguration of the Commonwealth, 1901]
other_title: [Federation parade and ceremony in Sydney on January 1st 1901]
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Australia - Politics and government
abstract: The parade and ceremony in Sydney on January 1st, 1901, to celebrate the inauguration of the Commonwealth.
description: The parade and ceremony in Sydney on January 1st, 1901, to celebrate the inauguration of the Commonwealth. Shot by the Salvation Army’s Limelight Department, the film shows the parade through the streets of Sydney by the police, firefighters, decorated floats and large numbers of Australian and Imperial troops, and carriages carrying the Governor-General, Lord Hopetoun, first prime Minister Edmund Barton, state premiers and other dignitaries. They arrive at Centennial Park and there are close-ups of the main participants as they walk past a guard of honour and enter the pavilion where they sign the Federation document. Additional footage shows the scene the following day at Centennial Park when the Governor-General, his staff and leading military figures review Australian and Imperial troops. Over 10,000 troops pass by. (14:00). General notes: This footage is included in a video compilation, ‘Federation Film’ (#65162) together with a detailed narration by Chris Long describing the activities and participants.

related_object_notes: This footage [Inauguration of the Commonwealth, 1901]  is also included in the video compilation, 509785 "Federation films: Australian films from early 20th century" together with a detailed narration by Chris Long describing the activities and participants.
